result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian J. Benson was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TRANSCRIPT OF PLEA & SENTENCING HELD ON 4/22/15 - KAREN BLAIR, REPORTER

ADDRESS INFO for Brian J. Benson
Current: 809 S Walker Way, Sun Prairie, WI 53590 United States  (Effective: 04-30-2015)
Prior: PO Box 903, Sturtevant Transition Facility, Sturtevant, WI 53177 United States

Atty Peebles states plea agreement to Ct. 1, OWI - 7th offense.  Ct. 2 along with 15TR150 & 15TR168 to be dismissed.  Atty Christianson agrees.
Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1, OWI - 7th offense. Ct. 2 along with 15TR150 & 15TR168 to be dismissed.

Atty Christianson makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Peebles makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, OWI - 7th offense:  Court orders 7 1/2 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 3 1/2 years Initial Confinement and 4 years Extended Supervision with conditions, concurrent to any other sentence.
Pay fine of $600 + costs
DNA Sample + surcharge
Eligible for Earned Release Program & Susbstance Abuse Program
3 years DL Revocation and Ignition Interlock

Ct. 2 along with 15TR150 & 15TR168 to be dismissed.
   
**Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
